--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@c...> wrote:
> > Has anyone heard of these guys?
> >
> > http://www.neuroblast.net
> 
> Woo. He has a patent on an "adaptive neural learning system" (USPTO
> 6,424,961), applied 1999, granted 2002. I only skimmed the patent,
but it
> sounds to me like he's laid claim to Hebbian learning in integrate and
> fire neural networks. Sounds a little overly broad to me.
> 
> Without any results posted, I'm a little wary as to evaluating the
method
> though.
> 

Briefly looking over their method, it doesn't look very principled.  I
mean it just seems like a glorified GP implementation.  Every once in
a while I see a site like this with very little detail but lots of
grandiose claims about changing the world.  You get the sense they
aren't aware of what's going on in the research world, because they
seem to think their idea is one-of-a-kind.

ken
